content: thankyou for purchasing my pattern feel free to contact me with any questions you may have regarding my pattern or any support you need i would love to see your completed projects and the colours you have used my details are as follows ravelry craftycollbarns instagram collbarnyarn email colleenbarns@gmail com facebook colleen barns 1 terminology this pattern uses mosaic crochet technique and is written in u s terminology this pattern is a written pattern only chain = normal chain used for cast on single_crochet = all single_crochet stitches unless stated differently are crochet into the back loop of the stitch and written as single_crochet double_crochet = all double_crochet stitches are crochet into the front loop of the stitch 2 row down and written as double_crochet the yarn is fastened off at the end of each row this leaves the tails which can be dealt with in numerous ways i have given examples and links at the completion of the red forest pattern the repeated stitches in each row are marked between example 2sc 4dc x 6 means repeating what is inside the brackets 6 times the row and colour are written in bold at the beginning of each row the first 2 and last 2 stitches of each row are crochet into both loops these stitches are not mentioned in the pattern this is to anchor your work and to stop it unravelling to start a row attach the next colour to the first stitch of the previous row by a slip_stitch single_crochet in the same stitch both loops then single_crochet in the next stitch both loops to finish each row single_crochet in both loops of the last 2 stitches cast off if you are not familiar with mosaic crochet i have included a youtube link below created by tinna thorudottir thorvaldar https //www youtube com/watch v=htigdtvdtlq 2 yarn and hook information i used hook size 4mm for the throw the yarn suggested a 5mm hook however i found it to be loose i liked the smaller hook which gave the throw a nicer texture hook size 3 5mm for the border yarn used for the throw 4 seasons half n half 50% acrylic 50% wool 100 gram balls 160 metres per ball yarn amounts white 5 x balls - 500 grams red- 4 x balls - 400 grams turquoise - 2 x balls - 200 grams yarn used for the hidden tails border envelope border 4 seasons half n half 50% acrylic 50% wool 100 gram balls 160 metres per ball yarn amounts red 2 balls - 200 grams turquoise 2 balls - 200 grams i suggest the use of stitch markers throughout the patterns throw measurements when blocked are 80cmx120cm you can use any weight of yarn with corresponding hook size for this project however keep in mind the size will vary accordingly 3 the designs pattern 1 - multiple diamonds - white/red pattern 2 - hill - white/turquoise pattern 3 - large tree - white/red
